image.altText: Elon Musk with his hands clasped together.

props.synopsis: Elon Musk's attempts to fight orders to remove graphic footage of the Sydney stabbings from X provokes fury among federal politicians, who are renewing their focus on punishing social media platforms that host misinformation and harmful content.

title.children: Musk's response to Sydney stabbing footage prompts fury, as opposition supports crackdown on social media giants

image.altText: A mother holding her young son

props.synopsis: One in 10 children will have a proven food allergy in their first year of life, and by school, there'll be at least one child in every classroom. Yet, there is still no approved treatment and more services are desperately needed.

title.children: Australia 'has a big problem' with food allergies, but the exact cause is unknown

image.altText: A map of Sydney alongside a woman shopping in a supermarket

props.synopsis: The cost of food is being felt nationally, but for some pockets of Australia, including parts of Greater Western Sydney, accessing nutritious food was already difficult. Some experts fear it could worsen health problems.

title.children: How the cost-of-living crisis is placing pressure on Australia's 'food deserts'

image.altText: Bronson Xerri high-fives Canterbury Bulldogs teammates before an NRL game.

props.synopsis: Cronulla could reclaim the number one spot on the NRL ladder with a win over the Cowboys, but today's first game features teams at the opposite end of the table. Follow live.

title.children: Knights superstar Kalyn Ponga off injured after in-goal blunder hands Bulldogs another try

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Concerns over Kalyn Ponga to start the second half
HALF-TIME: The Bulldogs are up 18-6 over Newcastle
1' The Knights kick off at the Olympic stadium

image.altText: Nick Blakey soars above a pack to take a mark

props.synopsis: The Sydney Swans have a chance to go up to second on the ladder, but they'll have to beat an in-form Gold Coast side to do it. Later, the Kangaroos will take on Hawthorn as Alastair Clarkson faces his old club. Follow live.

title.children: Swans locked in physical battle as Suns unleash academy stars on SCG

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Grundy mobbed after marking 200th with a goal
Jordon converts after another Suns turnover
3QT: Suns made to pay for lack of discipline

image.altText: Blue and white police tape in front of traffic accident scene

props.synopsis: From the east to the west, a spate of knife attacks sent fear through Sydney this week. While violent knife crime is declining nationally, buried under the top-line statistics is a more complicated picture.

title.children: Four days, five unrelated stabbing attacks: Sydney's horror week puts spotlight on knife crime

image.altText: A woman wearing a dark dress sits on a couch and holds a framed photograph.

props.synopsis: A dying mum could only communicate by blinking. She needed hospital staff to help convey a message, but they didn't want to hear it.

title.children: A mother's message and the hospital that didn't want to hear it

image.altText: four women speaking outside act courts

props.synopsis: A glitch in legislation means convicted sex offender Stephen Mitchell's prison sentence is likely to be slashed. The women at the centre of the case are lobbying the ACT government to ensure the same thing doesn't happen to others.

title.children: Victims of convicted child sex offender shocked to learn his sentence to be slashed

image.altText: A man holding and looking at a canister or bottle labelled as "pepper spray"

props.synopsis: Western Australia is the only Australian state or territory which allows people to have pepper spray for self-protection, and there have been calls to legalise the substance country-wide in the wake of Bondi's stabbing attack.

title.children: WA is the only Australian jurisdiction where it's legal to have pepper spray. Self-defence advocates want that to change

image.altText: A green Ford Mustang car parked in the middle of the road.

props.synopsis: With its slick build and muscle car vibes, Mark Johnson's Ford Mustang GT with all the trimmings from Bullitt looks like it belongs on the film set, roaring through the streets of San Francisco.

title.children: 'Aussie Bullitt' Ford Mustang GT passion project roars to life after McQueen's classic inspires

image.altText: Six packages wrapped in plastic with the word "evidence" printed on them.

props.synopsis: An alleged "cocaine kingpin" and drug mules have been arrested at Melbourne Airport with 30 kilograms of drugs found in their suitcases.

title.children: Arrests in Melbourne as Federal police allegedly smash an international cocaine smuggling ring

image.altText: Taylor Swift's new album cover in black and white with Taylor standing in the middle in a long white t shirt

props.synopsis: The pop sensation now holds the record for most-streamed album in a single day across Spotify, Apple, and Amazon Music.

title.children: Taylor Swift's The Tortured Poets Department breaks multiple records in 24 hours

image.altText: A closeup of a scientist's gloved hands doing delicate DNA work in a lab

props.synopsis: New figures show Queensland's forensics lab has retested less than two per cent of crime cases since the outcome of a commission of inquiry ordered they be reviewed.

title.children: Queensland's forensics lab has reviewed less than two per cent of cases since commission of inquiry

image.altText: Older man wearing cap, singlet and shorts laughs while standing on country football oval

props.synopsis: The country football club that made headlines for its big losses records its first win in more than 1,000 days. It marks a special moment for the community in Wahgunyah amid the club's fight for survival.

title.children: 'We did it!': Country footy team famous for losing finally gets famous win

props.synopsis: Below a treacherous group of rocks off the Tasman Peninsula is a colourful deep water reef full of thousands of fish, but it's in an area so rugged, diving it is not for the faint-hearted.

title.children: More than 3,000km south of the Great Barrier Reef lies a wonderland of sponges, fish and coral

image.altText: A graphic of Steven Miles and David Crisafulli with solar panels behind them

props.synopsis: Queensland wants to cut emissions by 75 per cent over the next decade. But it has a long way to go — given the Sunshine State had the lowest renewables contribution to the National Electricity Market last year.

title.children: Queensland's new renewable energy target was described as historic — but has mountain to climb

image.altText: Specialist staff at the Howard Springs facility wear heavy PPE gear.

props.synopsis: A joint inquest into the deaths of three people has heard of failings and extreme pressures at the Howard Springs quarantine facility during COVID.

title.children: Three deaths at Australia's 'gold standard' quarantine centre are being probed by the NT coroner

image.altText: Riley in a green, short-sleeve top holding arm up and smiling

props.synopsis: For Riley Blackwell, who had two brain tumours more than a decade ago, "laughter is the best medicine". He has joined a disability-led show on the Gold Coast, with the dream of becoming a "clown doctor".

title.children: Comedy helped Riley recover after brain-tumour surgery. Now he wants to be a clown doctor

image.altText: Gill nets being pulled in on the Norman River

props.synopsis: Residents of an isolated fishing community in the Gulf of Carpentaria say the town's survival is at the mercy of a pending Queensland government decision to restrict the use of gillnets to protect threatened, endangered, or protected species.

title.children: Restrictions posed on this $30 million fishery could push a remote coastal town to breaking point

image.altText: A Russian tank fires into the distance

props.synopsis: After stalling for months, billions of dollars in aid for Ukraine as well as money for Israel is approved by the US House.

title.children: $60b Ukraine aid package finally passes US House

image.altText: A composite of a harvard medical school buiding and a mugshot of a man with half face tattoo

props.synopsis: Investigators in the United States allege both morgue staff and collectors were part of an underground community willing to pay top dollar for human remains.

title.children: A group of people allegedly traded human remains stolen from facilities across the US. Officials say they may never know how many families were affected

image.altText: A close up of a man and a woman staring at each other eyes against a backdrop of planes flying over mountains.

props.synopsis: Myanmar has started to impose conscription laws that require young men and women to join the military. But people the ABC spoke to are considering getting married or fleeing the country to exploit a loophole.

title.children: 'We had to force ourselves to get married': Why couples in Myanmar are booking weddings to save the bride

image.altText: Dante Exum and Luka Doncic celebrate a bucket

props.synopsis: Dante Exum found himself in basketball wilderness for two years out of the NBA. Now he's back and making a major impact on one of the teams that could make a run at the title. Here are five burning questions ahead of the playoffs.

title.children: After spending two years in the wilderness, this Aussie could help swing the NBA title

image.altText: Two white women wearing white political campaign t shirts stand and smile by the side of a road

props.synopsis: Two lifelong friends join forces to campaign for a single seat in federal parliament. They want to show that politics can be done differently – but not everyone's convinced it can work.

title.children: These two women are running for federal parliament as a single candidate

image.altText: Michelle sits in shadows to protect her identity.

props.synopsis: Coercive control will become a criminal offence in Queensland next year, carrying a maximum sentence of up to 14 years in jail, but survivors fear police won't be equipped to respond.

title.children: 'They just didn't want to go there': A woman subjected to coercive control for years says police will struggle under new laws

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: Still bragging about that one time you won trivia? I'll fix that.

title.children: Bit of a self-confessed quiz expert? I’ll be the judge of that. Let's play, HARD

image.altText: Two women and a toddler girl in a hospital room. One of the women lays in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: Australian netball international Kim Ravaillion is back on court, months after being warned she was at high risk of injury after spinal surgery to ease lower back pain.

title.children: Back pain didn't stop Kim Ravaillion's glittering netball career. Neither has spinal surgery

image.altText: woman standing on balcony

props.synopsis: Gail Cocksedge says she has built "a beautiful little nest of people" around her since her husband left her 40 years ago. She is glad she was younger when they separated, given the financial impact.

title.children: Gail, 73, is living proof that age matters when it comes to divorce, as research shows extent of financial impact

image.altText: A punnet of ripe red strawberries, and an older couple bent over plants in a strawberry field, smiling.

props.synopsis: Now a well-worn stop for tourists at the top end of the Sunshine State, Ballantyne's Strawberry Farm is known for its early adoption of agritourism.

title.children: Trailblazing 'pick your own' strawberry farmers call time after decades of sweet success

image.altText: A recycle bin overflows with electrical and other waste while furniture and bags litter the grass footpath.

props.synopsis: In a council area in Melbourne's north, patrols aren't just targeting piles of illegally dumped rubbish on nature strips — they're also helping educate residents about their waste disposal options.

title.children: Melbourne council patrols suburban streets to tackle illegal rubbish

image.altText: A woman soccer player wearing green, white and black shirt points to the sky during a game

props.synopsis: Canberra United has been given a one-off funding lifeline to play in the A-League Women competition next season. But what's their future beyond that?

title.children: How long can a professional women's football team survive for on 'the smell of an oily rag'?
